name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sean1058, chivalress, bug, farqussus, pitseleh, ketamind, ravindra108, trawser)

name: saint
text:
Why the fuck did I? Goddamnit I am retarded.
I knew. I always knew.

name: soticoto
text: You were right though.

name: afkpuz
text: A comment left by afkpuz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by thehelmet, Johnnyrocker, ConnorMc)

name: falseprophet
text: Tomorrow is throwing a hissy fit at today.

name: hipjiverobot
text: I need to say it more, relating to things that are not phones. Also things that are phones maybe.

name: lordpretzel
text:
"I say this often."

You say this often.

name: trevor
text: Why is this story line not higher rated? It is one of my favorites.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I have to say, that of the continuing story-lines, this is my least favorite. It does have a couple great moments, though.

name: riazm
text: Nice work saying that in such a way that you didn't get lamed. Normally you can guarantee being balls deep in lames nearly four seconds after saying an Achewood storyline isn't your favourite one.

name: norsef
text: That's because most people are a dick about it.

name: telescreen
text: It was hard to resist laming him so long after the fact, but I did because it is okay that he dislikes one of my favorite arcs. It is okay. I tell myself this.

name: achilleselbow
text: The two parts of your question have no relation to each other.

name: gkiyo
text: I want this security system.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Confusion is one of the most powerful weapons that exists.

name: stuart
text: he has the same feeling on phones as Ralf Hütter of Kraftwerk

name: jesler729
text: God I can just imagine this dude's voice perfectly. It's uncanny.

name: isunklower
text:
Which is how exactly? I kind of imagine him talking really fast and really loud, like in the first movies with sound.

This could be because Lonis mentions "talkies" in the next strip, though.

name: buttermoths
text:
I always imagined him talking like David Lynch's character in season two of Twin Peaks (Gordon Cole, I think his name was).
Which is really fast and REALLY loud, just like you said.

name: notcool
text:
I always imagined the voice as that of a grown-up Elroy, trppin' HARD on shrooms and trying to maintain.

While telling himself it's not okay to eat These guests.

name: farqussus
text: likewise, also with the whirring of the projector behind you as you look at him.

name: k_buttsworthe
text: brother has a neon glow surrounding him

name: goocifer
text: I imagine faint carnival music playing in the background of this whole arc

name: jandruff
text: I've just realized how weird it is to see a human face drawn in Onstad's style in this comic.

name: gethen
text: The glowing man asks the cats with glasses for tech support.

name: charchar
text: So, did their legs sort of shrivel away, or is the door superbly tall?  I checked the previous comic, and noticed no evidence in either direction.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Check this one , panels 2 and 3, you'll notice their legs getting shorter as they walk towards the warehouse. I'm assuming they're back to normal by the time they reach the door.

name: sevenarts
text: This arc is surreal even by Achewood standards, but there's something I really like about the bizarre, creepy ghost guy. It reminds me of something that Al Columbia might draw, where the cheerful tone just makes it even creepier.

name: boredom_man
text:
All of the sound and fury of misogyny that Nice Pete can come up with will never evoke the hurt, rage, and self-pity of Lonis' two sentences about women. "It's all she does."

It's projection, of course. The man lives his life out of focus. But it's the kind of poetic projection that slaps Nietzsche's ass and teaches him Frenchman.

name: salvagebar
text: Only its location at the bottom of this thread prevents this comment from receiving its rightful chubbitude.

name: deusoma
text: Ray and Butters share a moment in panel 9. Even if you hate the guy you're with, at least you know what you're in for with him.

name: hyetal
text:
"Lost? Welcome! There, you're found."

"A phone is like a woman who hates you. It's all she does."

I get the feeling that Lonis just talks to himself constantly, trying to work out lines like this, just waiting for an opportunity to use them. He wouldn't be the only one.

name: joestork
text: Is Lonis supposed to be a take off on Julianne Moore's character in the Big Lebowski?  The alt text would indicate so...

name: shutup_shutup
text: I don't really think that Maude Lebowski has a monopoly on the word "thorough."

name: joestork
text:
True, but Lonis's clipped, patrician way of speaking, as well as the way he breathlessly piles one crazy-ass statement on top of another, is similar to Maude, don't you think?

He looks pretty different, though.

name: lolsworth
text: Anyone else getting a Norton Juster vibe from this whole arc?
